cab.content: From Sir P. Cox, Bagdad, loth May 1917. (Addressed to Foreign, repeated to Secretary of State for India.) (Received at India Office, 9 a.m. 14th.)r,1613. Secretary of State's telegram of 9th May. Salary of General Clayton. Presume that for the period of war his salary should he assessed with regard to my own salary. I do not draw salaiy as Chief Political Officer, but receive Rs. 4,000 a month as Resident in the Persian Gulf. I suggest that he should draw Rs. 2,750 per mensem, same as drawn by Dobbs who was next senior officer to me.
